Others: The Chicago White Sox suffered their 121st defeat on September 28, 2024, surpassing the modern-day record of 120 losses held by the 1962 New York Mets.
White Sox starter Sean Burke pitched five scoreless innings, allowing two hits, striking out six, and walking three.
Bryan Ramos and Andrew Benintendi hit home runs for the White Sox, with Benintendi's blast being his 20th of the season.
Grady Sizemore, the interim manager, praised the team's resilience and competitive spirit despite the challenging season.
